revised_title: The Efficiency of Various Substances in Removing Micro-Organisms from Water
tldr: The author investigates the effectiveness of various substances, such as greensand, silver sand, powdered glass, brickdust, coke, animal charcoal, and spongy iron, in removing micro-organisms from water. The results show that these materials can effectively remove a significant proportion of micro-organisms from contaminated water, with animal charcoal demonstrating excellent filtering capabilities.
